remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided associated valve is verified closed after engine start.

numlitem.para: Start engine and check the following:
After placing engine switch in GND, observe that duct pressure has a sudden drop with only partial recovery.

note.para: If no drop in duct pressure is observed, refer to MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES 80-00-02 for appropriate procedure.

numlitem.para: Observe at approximately 52% N2 (PW) or 47% N3 (RB211), the start switch returns to AUTO and the duct pressure returns to value prior to start. This confirms that starter control valve closed.

caution.para: ABORT THE START ATTEMPT IF START SWITCH DOES NOT RETURN TO AUTO BY 52% N2 (PW) OR 47% N3 (RB211) OR DUCT PRESSURE DOES NOT RETURN TO VALUE PRIOR TO START, STARTER MAY BE DAMAGED.

placard.para: Placard affected Engine Start Valve Light "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Have crew use pneumatic duct pressure indication to ensure start valve is closed.
If crew can not verify start valve closed, manually close start valve per the following procedure.

caution.para: DO NOT USE SHORTER EXTENSIONS TO MAKE UP THE 18-INCH EXTENSION. DAMAGE TO ENGINE COULD RESULT.

note.para: Core cowl panels should remain closed.

numlitem.para: Insert 3/8-inch square drive with 18 inch extension through access port in core cowl and engage drive into valve override 3/8-inch internal receptacle.
Rotate drive clockwise to ensure valve is closed.
Normal engine start may be performed from flight deck provided MEL Operations procedures are followed.
Open starter control valve access panel and check that starter control valve position indication shows valve is closed.
Close starter control valve access panel.
Normal engine start may be performed from flight deck provided MEL Operations procedures are followed.
